Reviews.Title: “nice to have a kitchnette but...”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: the location of town was a bit sketchy. the value was pretty good & the rooms were ok & clean. very small though. only stay here if you can't afford anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuck333
Reviews.Content: What can you say about the Grange that isn't already said on their web site. It's not the Hilton but they really don't try to be. It's good accommodation for a reasonable price. I like the fact that it's right in Chinatown. I live The shops and restaurants there. We went to a Blue Jays game. That was easy. You just walk east two block, get on a streetcar and it takes you right there. We went to the CNE. That was easy. Go west two blocks, board a streetcar and it takes you right there. Check-in was efficient and friendly. You're left to handle your own bags. The hotel is an older apartment building with all rooms being bachelor apartments. They all have a stove, fridge, microwave and a few dishes (not many). If you want a coffee maker, you need to ask at the office and pay a $10 deposit. Parking with full in and out privileges is $4/day, a bargain in T.O. The rooms are kept clean and so are the common areas. There's a coin laundry room on each floor. If you're looking for a good location, reasonable, clean accommodations, not too fancy, try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: Boli1983
Reviews.Content: Good location. Staff are helpful. The rooms are relatively clean. We used the kitchenette to make breakfast every morning so that helped us save a bit of money. Just make sure you wash plates/bowls/utensils before you use them. Free WiFi. Beds were a bit too soft for my liking. Quite good value for the location. Just remember it's a no frills place when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice hotel, recommended to tourists”
Reviews.Author: Marisha_n1
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived, we had read negative responses about criminality of the surrounding area. The hotel is situated 3 minutes walk from the heart of Chinatown with restaraunts and close to Queen street with bars and clubs. It is easy to access mostly all attractions by foot. The kitchenette in the studio we lived in is clean and equipped with all necessary devices and dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal (not in a Euro design way), great location, this is bargin basement”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2010 for 5 nights.Would have changed locations but the city was booked up - we even were looking for other paces where we would have paid more than double. Anyhow: the bathroom and kitchenette area seemed to be clean. The carpet looked not so clean - but vacuumed, at least. The beds felt like they had spent the better part of their life at a summer camp. Old window air conditioners were noisy. That all said, it is super inexpensive, in a decently safe part of town - which is a really interesting part of the city (Queen Street). Fridge worked fine and so did the internet. Would recommend only for those willing to have dorm room experience.

Reviews.Title: “should be ready to change the room at midnight”
Reviews.Author: SwedaranyamR
Reviews.Content: was there during july 2010.during second night got tok tok sound from A/C.On enquiry found out that water falling from A/c from room above.Had to change the room at 2 a.m.Otherwise alright.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Motel which I was forced to stop at when tired along the Highway is a 4* compared to this”
Reviews.Author: sandblue8
Reviews.Content: Noisey, cut off your airconditioning dirty and office/management staff that could care less just as the nice weather hits and you get settled to relax every peice of machinery known to man is used to distrube your peace Why don't you ever work" Oh sorry for relaxing and yes I have worked this is why I can do this now in my life and I have earned it without ever collecting from any gov't. agency Thank You Very Much!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lower prices is its main positive but rooms, sheets, and the surrounding area are quite dirty”
Reviews.Author: pmsocc17
Reviews.Content: The prices this place charges are really low (compared to some of the other places in downtown Toronto) but the rooms are not clean. The bathrooms are nice but just so so. The best thing about it is the location - at Augusta Ave and Grange Ave - a few minutes walk from Queen St W on the south and Chinatown on the east. So its easy to get to most of the places in downtown. But the hotel itself is an apartment building and the owner or manager rents out a few units as rooms for travelers to stay. There is what looks like a housing project next to this hotel. They provide free internet (but no wifi; you use an ethernet cable) in the rooms. There is a surcharge if you pay using Amex. So, use visa or mc to avoid that. Parking is about 3.50 bucks a night. Weekend rates tend to be higher than the weekday rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near downtown and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: gnarang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because there was heavy premium in other hotels but this is a fine place. This is near Chinatown and is a clean hotel with in room cooking. The room size is small but is not bad for a sleep.

Reviews.Title: “was a cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TimminsNortherner
Reviews.Content: needed a place while we travelled from northern ontario for a medical appointment. this was a reasonable priced hotel near the hospital... also this place had a AWESOME view of the CN Tower... the room was clean... however the bed was not comfortable for 2 people to sleep in

Reviews.Title: “great for price”
Reviews.Author: tiaras
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights in September. it is just as it says on the website, small studio units with full bathroom. we booked for the price and i was a bit concerned about cleanliness but when we arrived the place didnt smell at all as other reviews said and it was clean and quiet. we didnt cook there as food is cheap but the option was good and having a fridge meant we could have cold breakfasts before heading out, chill drinks etc. the laundry room was handy with easy to use washer and dryer. staff were friendly and i loved the location. we were joining friends for a wedding in the downtown area and were booked in there for 4 days with them if i had to chose location i would go to the grange. we were so close to West Queen West for great bars and shops also Kensington Market was really close. if you like to feel like you are getting a real local feel then head here for the location. downtown is great but just a huge city like anywhere. for price and if you like your location quirky then here is great

Reviews.Title: “Spartan”
Reviews.Author: vampirate
Reviews.Content: Simple, dorm-like rooms, including a kitchenette. I was very impressed with the cleanliness...even the shower and tub were pristine. Staff was friendly, parking was cheap, and the location was fantastic. The Grange is within perfect walking distance for the CN tower, West Queen Street, and the AGO.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Toronto, OK”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Review â€“ The Grange Hotel 165 Grange Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M5T 2V5 Hotel location was good spot, near downtown attractions. Just off Dundas and Queen St near downtown core. Walk distance to Chinatown and downtown. The parking lot is very affordable to park, around $3 a day for 2000, which is great compared to the norm of 25 to 30 bucks in main downtown lots. Rooms were good price as under $90 a night which is a total bargain for downtown Toronto. However, you get what you pay for, rooms were small and dirty. Condom wrappers and cigarette butts on the carpet. TV in the room had old fashioned (bunny ear) attenna to get the signals. Neighbourhood had lots of welfare apartments located in the area, with a heavy police presence nearby. Elevator was kinda slow and squeaky. No front desk was there, it was just a former broom closest where a desk was placed. I would stay here again, just for the price. Otherwise I would steer clear. But good for someone on a tight budget. Heres the links below. 165 Grange Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M5T 2V5 http://www.grangehotel.com

Reviews.Title: “Good value, definately not luxury”
Reviews.Author: JustinandAmanda
Reviews.Content: From the reviews a read here, I was a little scared. But it was the cheapest place available so I went anyways. The front office is quite cluttered and gives you a bad impression, but the guy at check-in was super nice and even let me check in two hours early with no extra charges. The whole hotel smells like moth balls, but if you can get past that you'll be fine. The rooms were really clean... and (surprisingly) the mattresses were amazing!!! To location is great... 20 minute walk from downtown. Many reviews mentioned the sketchy location, but I really don't see what the problem was. The apartments across the street offered at "interesting view", but the rest of the neighbourhood was just fine. It's definately not a hotel that you're going to relax in all day, but as a home base to lay your head at, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: GotXiney
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood isn't the greatest looking, and the rooms were quite dated, but for what we wanted (central location, cheap) we got more than we deserved! Nice and clean, very comfortable. Air Conditionning was essential since it was SCORCHING hot while we were there. (The smog in Toronto was unbelieveable) We didn't get to make use of the kitchenette since we were barely in the place, but it sure would have come in handy, especially if we'd stayed longer than two nights. You are right next to Chinatown though, so who feels like cooking with dim sum next door?

Reviews.Title: “relieved”
Reviews.Author: SMENG
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room nearby, but cancelled after seeing the reviews on trip advisor. Previous reviews for the Grange were also poor, but we decided to take a chance. Contrary to others, we found the place to be clean and friendly. Our room smelt a little when we first entered, but we opened the window and all was well after a short time. They came and cleaned the rooms and made beds every day. The suite facilities were just what we needed to prepare breakfast, lunch and snacks, and we had internet access in the room, which meant that we could do our homework everyday before heading out. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The area is run down, but the Grange is so close to great facilities - we in particular found the free community swimming pool nearby and the children's park really important for entertaining our 6 year old at low cost - also fantastic music and great food in the Kensington Market and Chinatown areas. I would certainly stay here if we ever come back!

Reviews.Title: “Actually get less than what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: crems
Reviews.Content: There's city project housing across the street, there was filth on the floor and I woke up in the middle of the night to ratsâ€”Yes, you read correctly, ratsâ€”in the vents. Nightmare.....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaf
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit dodgy, surrounded by low-rent housing. A brisk 20 minute walk to downtown. The major street three blocks to the south has "funky" shops and restaurants. The check-in office is a cluttered mess, looks like somebody's home office. Friendly service. The room was small, old, dank, not well appointed. The mattress was not up to North American standards, was what you might get in a Pension in Europe. Overall, reminded me of my back-packer/youth hostel days. Okay if you are slumming it on your own, but NOT the place to stay if you are on vacation (especially if your wife/significant other/etc is with you). Would have moved on, but had pre-paid in full.

Reviews.Title: “There is better than this.”
Reviews.Author: a7m9w
Reviews.Content: Rooms had funny smell. Was told it was a bad area but didnt have any problems. On the good side cheap and close for street car to down town. All in all very basic

Reviews.Title: “Basic room and service”
Reviews.Author: Penelope_Potter
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced, basic room, this is what you'll get. The immediate neighborhood is questionable (and noisy), but you are SO close to the fabulous Kensington Market District (vintage shops). A single woman might not feel comfortable staying there alone. The room is small, but adequate. It wasn't super clean, but it wasn't disgusting. There was a double bed and a single. The single was not very comfortable. If you've got two people or more, I'd advise requesting additional pillows. The room does have a microwave, fridge, kitchen sink, toaster and a few basic dishes/utensils. No alarm clock or hair dryer in the room. I was able to 'borrow' a hair dryer from the office. Would stay there again. I'd just bring an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Grange Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The picture of the hotel on the website looked nice, but not when you actually went to the hotel. The office did not look like a hotel office. I felt uneasy walking around the neighborhood on the first day. But after one day of stay, I became comfortable with the surrounding. The price for one night stay was cheaper compared to other places, and there was free internet access and private bathroom. Our room was not vacuumed everyday, and airconditioning unit was too loud. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom, or in the room. When I used the bread toaster, the smoke alarm would make a loud noise. The price for one night of stay was $75 because we were quoted the weekly rate. It was affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Timboe
Reviews.Content: I can't express enough....don't waste your money. Our first impression was this is not a hotel but an apartment building, and very run down. It may be in the downtown area, but when you drive down the side street to get there, it is a run down residential area with the view of laundry hanging out on the front yards. We decided to go take a look inside anyways, I think more out of curiosity then anything. The room was small with a double bed and a single bed, but not the quality of hotel we are used to. The room smelled, was very cramped and frankly we felt like we were in a sleezy hotel. We booked this hotel through Hotelca, something I would never do again, as we were not refunded our money. Once you book through them, you can't change your mind, even if your not satisfied with the hotel choice and want to book something else. Three words....don't go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully weather was nice!”
Reviews.Author: alchor
Reviews.Content: so we did not have to stay in the room. At first the smell of the first floor room then it is not true the room was not done once a day sorry! Parking is no longer free if it used to be but at 4$ a day let's not complain. Very surprising thing the bath towels were so small and with holes in it so you better bring your own. Not expensive but you really get a little less than what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “When hotels became more lucrative than apartments....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grange hotel with two friends and we had a few laughs about this place as soon as we checked in. To give an idea of what to expect: It is an old apartment building that has turned into a hotel. The rooms are about the size of a deluxe student dorm, and are abit 'snug' because of the two beds - Queen and a single. There is nothing glamorous about this place, but if you need a place to sleep and wash up so you can explore Toronto, and don't want to spend $100+ per night, this is your place. Even better, you can cook your own food! Microwave, stove, fridge and sink! The average meal in TO is about $12-15per person... cooking in your room can be a great way to save money to explore the city with. True to the other reviews, the halls do have a smell and our room did not. We also had an air conditioner, but it couldn't keep up with the heat, so for the most part, we were quite warm. The shower pressure was good, the toilet worked... there is a table for two, a small desk, a television... Bang for the buck, its a good deal. If you're used to turn down service, this may not be your place. Exect friendly front desk service, a free newspaper at the front door of the building, free coffee in the front desk area... and free parking. You don't find this in many places. We had to change hotels and with parking and the change in rates, each night cost us $100 MORE than at the Grange.. The neighbourhood looks abit sketchy, but our BMW didn't get harassed that night. While this place wasn't what we expected, we still had a good nights sleep and if it were not a question of convenience, we would have stayed throughout our entire reservation. That said, there were no hassels about our early check out and our cc was credited the difference without question. You pay for your entire stay upon checkin. Any incidentals are dealt with at check out - like any hotel. The great thing about this place is that they did their best and we had no problems. Parking - Free Coffee (front desk) - Free Newspaper - Free Kitchenette, eating area, desk, television Air Conditioner (not designed for really hot days/nights) Beds - 1 Queen that is comfortable, 1 single that is ideal for children. Bathroom - fully functional but very old looking. You won't feel like you're treating yourself when you stay here, but the money you save will let you do more things that you enjoy during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think that this place should get 5 Stars because of the price. I am 20 yrs old and a student so i needed a cheap room for New Years 04'. Three of us stayed in two rooms and partied loud all night and no complaits. I was scard of booking the rooms there because of the reviews, but it was fine. Not a Hilton Hotel but worth the $100. Plus its sooo close to Richmond st. ....bars..!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay place, amazing rates!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at the grange, we were put into the alexandra (didn't matter to us). I will be short and honest about his place. It ain't a 5 star, probably not even a 3 star. The place is clean and parking is dirt cheap for downtown. The rates are amazing considering you are a 5 minute walk to the entertainment district. What else do you want in downtown Toronto for $100?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All staff was Courteous and Friendly Room was clean and comfortable Room was made up each day Central location is ideal, easy walking distance to most tourist attractions. Very close to Toronto Transit Area is in Chinatown which is interesting to see If you stay in the "Suburbs" you will miss out on this area of Toronto There was a 'cooking" smell in the hallways but it was not in the rooms I would book into here again

Reviews.Title: “It's only about money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the positive side you get A so called efficiency kitchen with a few utensils, glasses,spoon fork etc., A small fridge, A small mocrowave oven with knobs, public transportation at walking distance on Dundas/China town, Parking in compound at a nominal rate,Laundry room with an Iron Box - All depends on how you use it. Daily cleaning works well. 2 out of 3 staff felt comfortable dealing with. On the negative side ... Looking at the age of the building I did not expect a Lift(we discovered it the second day) .. and we went thru the stairways and it smelled horrible. This must be due to no ventilation. The passage inside also had a sort of smell. I wonder the second day I did not feel it. Did we already get used to it?! The room is dusty .. You can feel it in your nostrils. Sitting at the centre of the mattress is like sitting in a pit. In a first look everything looks neat but not in a closer look. The utensils are probably the cheapest available. No good restaurent other than a chinese one nearby. In short this place needs a better mangement and maintenance and at the moment good only if you want to save some bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Advice to Stay away”
Reviews.Author: eers
Reviews.Content: The total charge for 1 night was about CAD 110. The same people also run Alexanda Apartment hotel, which is only a block away.. I had booked my room in Grange Hotel and was directed to Alexandra when we arrived to checkin. All cons, no pros 1) The room had a very bad smell of some dog/pet 2) The bed and other stuff in the room were very old. 3) The guy at reception was very rude, when asked for direction to nearest scotia bank location 4) Though they claim the hotel is at the heart of the city, The area where the hotel located is shady/fishy I am not some one who used to 3* facilities and got shocked seeing a small scale hotel. This stay was really a worst experience by any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grange this last weekend while attending a wedding of a friend. For an incredibly reasonable price, you are getting a fun, central location (Chinatown and Kensington), a clean, tidy room, and some very nice folks running the place. We were there with our 2 year old, and the double bed plus twin bed room was perfect for a couple with a child. A great place to stay on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “not good!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: unfortunatly the comfort i expected didn't materialise. i know it was reasonably cheap, but it was more like a backpackers hostel. the room and corridors were smelly. it was a tight squeeze up the side of the bed to get to the cooking facilitities which were none too clean. the air conditioner was held together with sticky tape, the carpet was quite worn and the bed was very soft. for similar money in toronto you could get a clean, comfortable hotel with a lobby and reception which actually feels like a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the website and reviews I expected it to be pleasant. Nothing fancy but nice. It was okay. It seemed clean. It was not even close to roomy or spacious - at least not our room. We were on the 4th floor. There was no coffee-pot (or coffee) but I had brought tea bags and there was a kettle and microwave. The double-bed was too soft, the single a brick. It's not the quietest area of town. Not traffic noise but people noise. People yelling at night. They do have their own parking but it's open and not monitored. We didn't have any problems. The management was friendly and helpful. The only problem we had was when we went out for the night, we left the window open. When we came back, it was closed. Nothing was missing but that made me uncomfortable. I'd have to be hard-pressed to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grange hotel this past weekend and I must say I was plesantly surprised. For the price it was great...decent sided room, high speed internet, kitchen with stove and microwave, etc. I stayed for 4 nights and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: bilti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grange June 8th to the 13th 2003 myslf my wife and three children aged 26, 21, 13, we had 2 rooms next to each other and found it to be clean and spacious acommodation with the bedding changed during our stay. It is in a very colourful area near Chinatown and Kensington Market with Spadina close by for the tramcar to the CN tower and attractions nearby and Queens for east west tramcars to Yonge and the shopping area. The rates are reasonable and would suit anyone on a budget.

HotelInfo.Name: The Grange Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 165 Grange Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M5T 2V5, Canada
